articles.title: Groundhog Day 2026: Willie in Ontario, Fred in Quebec predict early spring
articles.description: Canada’s famous prognosticating rodents are predicting an early spring. Wiarton Willie, in Bruce County, Ont., and Fred la Marmotte, the famous groundhog in Quebec’s Gaspesie region, reportedly did not see their shadows this morning, which is good news for people tired of wintry weather.

articles.title: What to expect as businessman Frank Stronach stands trial on sexual assault charges
articles.description: TORONTO — The man long touted as one of Canada’s great success stories is set to stand trial in Toronto this week, as the first of two cases accusing Frank Stronach of sexual offences against several women over decades begins. articles.title: What will job cuts at war, history museums mean for programming?
articles.description: Canadian Museum of History and Canadian War Museum to shed dozens of staff as part of government spending review.

articles.title: Nuclear refurbishment done and under budget at Ontario’s Darlington plant: minister
articles.description: A nuclear refurbishment at the Darlington power plant is now complete and the unit is set to soon return to service. Energy Minister Stephen Lecce is making the announcement today, saying the refurbishment is four months ahead of schedule and $150 million under budget. The overall refurbishment budg

articles.description: Canadian military goes to U.S. for F-35 ceremony despite renewed trade tensions  CBC

articles.title: These AI notetaking devices can help you record and transcribe your meetings
articles.description: These physical notetakers transcribe audio and give users summaries and action items of meetings using AI. Some even offer live translation.

articles.title: Scientists are hunting for a forbidden antimatter transformation
articles.description: MACE is a next-generation experiment designed to catch muonium transforming into its antimatter twin, a process that would rewrite the rules of particle physics.
